title: 107_s2458
content: Establishment of initiatives for predominantly Muslim countries. The Congress finds that negative opinions of the United States in predominantly Muslim countries are distorted by misinformation and propaganda, which is detrimental to US interests. To improve this image, programs promoting American society and values should be established. The Secretary of State is tasked with creating these initiatives. The Secretary of State is required to establish programs promoting American society and values among predominantly Muslim populations. This includes a journalism program for foreign journalists and students, as well as a demonstration program to improve public library systems in foreign countries. The Secretary of State implements programs to promote American values, including a demonstration program to improve public library systems in foreign countries, English language teaching grants, and sister city partnerships. The Secretary of State implements programs to promote American values, including sister city partnerships, youth ambassador visits, and teaching assistant programs with shared salary costs. Sister city partnerships aim to increase global cooperation at the community level, while youth ambassador visits familiarize students with American society and values. The Secretary of State implements programs to promote American values through activities for students from diverse countries, including cultural and educational experiences in the U.S. The Fulbright exchange program aims to increase awards for individuals studying or teaching in predominantly Muslim countries, with a focus on American studies. The Secretary aims to increase awards for individuals studying or teaching in predominantly Muslim countries, including Hubert H. Humphrey Fellowships. Programs will be carried out under specific acts. The Secretary will establish a database of American and foreign alumni of international exchange programs to promote networking and communication. Additionally, a report will be issued on the inclusion of freedom and democracy advocates in educational and cultural exchange programs. The Secretary of State is required to submit a report to Congress within 90 days regarding the inclusion of freedom and democracy advocates in educational and cultural exchange programs. The report will detail the number of grants for exchange programs, measures taken to ensure advocates are considered in the selection process, and evaluate if US exchange programs are fully open to advocates. Additionally, a statutory construction is outlined. The Act does not authorize visas or admission to the US for inadmissible aliens. $35,000,000 is authorized for the Department of State for 2003 and 2004. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of State.
